column4: How can i reinstall ubuntu ("Format it") without using the CD? I am using ubuntu now, and i just want it to go back to the way it was when i first installed it. Thanks! :)
Sorry, a separate /home partition, I mean
I think unetbootin works on Linux as well
See list of available OS's via unetbootin here: http://lubi.sourceforge.net/unetbootin.html
Did you burn the iso images to disk or the iso itself?
How did you burn the disk?
Correct. But partitioning is the better option...
Partion first, then delete your current install's partition.
when you finish, you will end up with 2 ubuntu. Your original and your new one. Lubi/unetbootin does not erase the entire disk.
Use unetbootin. When finished. Use gparted to delete the old partition.
